repositories.brief_summary: Major GC performance improvements, enhanced memory profiling, and error message refinements dominate this week's activity
repositories.new_features_summary: New stack memory tracking, improved memory profiling API, and major GC sweep-only phase for better performance
repositories.new_features:
- **Stack memory tracking** restored in `Gc.stat` with new `live_stacks_words` field for monitoring fiber memory usage ([#14168](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14168))
- **Enhanced memory profiling** with `Gc.Memprof.start` now allowing profile replacement without stopping in all domains, plus new `is_sampling` function ([#14053](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14053))
- **Mark-delay GC performance improvement** introducing sweep-only phase at start of major GC cycle, reducing latent garbage delay by approximately half a major GC cycle ([#13580](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13580))
- **Runtime fiber cache optimization** ensuring aligned fibers are hosted in cache whenever possible, fixing corner cases where small fibers avoided the cache on reallocation ([#14169](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14169))
- **Ephemeron performance optimization** by removing duplicate status check in `orph_ephe_list_verify_status` ([#14175](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14175))
- **Row type error message improvements** showing type aliases for row types in error messages, e.g. `< foo : int; .. as $0>` when `$0` is introduced by a GADT constructor ([#14147](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14147))
- **Nonexpansive %identity primitive** recognition allowing compiler to properly handle `Obj.magic` and similar primitives without value restriction ([#14029](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14029))
- **Enhanced deprecation alerts** now include filename location for implicit uses of bundled libraries (unix, re, threads, dynlink) ([#14176](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14176))

group_summaries.brief_summary: Major GC performance improvements and OCaml Language Committee governance policy development dominate this week
group_summaries.new_features_summary: Stack memory tracking, enhanced memory profiling API, and mark-delay GC sweep-only phase for better performance
group_summaries.new_features:
- **Stack memory tracking** restored in `Gc.stat` with new `live_stacks_words` field for monitoring fiber memory usage ([ocaml/ocaml#14168](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14168))
- **Enhanced memory profiling** with `Gc.Memprof.start` now allowing profile replacement without stopping in all domains, plus new `is_sampling` function ([ocaml/ocaml#14053](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14053))
- **Mark-delay GC performance improvement** introducing sweep-only phase at start of major GC cycle, reducing latent garbage delay by approximately half a major GC cycle ([ocaml/ocaml#13580](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13580))
- **Runtime fiber cache optimization** ensuring aligned fibers are hosted in cache whenever possible, fixing corner cases where small fibers avoided the cache on reallocation ([ocaml/ocaml#14169](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14169))
- **Ephemeron performance optimization** by removing duplicate status check in `orph_ephe_list_verify_status` ([ocaml/ocaml#14175](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14175))
- **Row type error message improvements** showing type aliases for row types in error messages, e.g. `< foo : int; .. as $0>` when `$0` is introduced by a GADT constructor ([ocaml/ocaml#14147](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14147))
- **Nonexpansive %identity primitive** recognition allowing compiler to properly handle `Obj.magic` and similar primitives without value restriction ([ocaml/ocaml#14029](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14029))
- **Enhanced deprecation alerts** now include filename location for implicit uses of bundled libraries (unix, re, threads, dynlink) ([ocaml/ocaml#14176](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14176))
group_summaries.group_overview:

- **Governance formalization** in [ocaml/RFCs](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs) with the OCaml Language Committee establishing formal conflict of interest policies and transparency requirements
- **Jane Street feature integration** continuing with `%identity` nonexpansive recognition and include functor implementation from OxCaml in [ocaml/ocaml#14029](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14029) and [ocaml/ocaml#14177](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14177)
- **Developer experience improvements** through enhanced error messages for type system edge cases and better debugging information across the core compiler
- **Community engagement** with language feature discussions on effect syntax and tuple coercion proposals receiving detailed community feedback

weekly_summary.new_features_summary: GC performance optimizations, SIMD stabilization, OxCaml parameterized libraries, DNS stack 10.2.0, and build system enhancements
weekly_summary.new_features:
- __RUMINANT:core__ **Stack memory tracking** restored in `Gc.stat` with new `live_stacks_words` field for monitoring fiber memory usage ([ocaml/ocaml#14168](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14168))
- __RUMINANT:core__ **Enhanced memory profiling** with `Gc.Memprof.start` now allowing profile replacement without stopping in all domains, plus new `is_sampling` function ([ocaml/ocaml#14053](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14053))
- __RUMINANT:core__ **Mark-delay GC performance improvement** introducing sweep-only phase at start of major GC cycle, reducing latent garbage delay by approximately half a major GC cycle ([ocaml/ocaml#13580](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13580))
- __RUMINANT:core__ **Nonexpansive %identity primitive** recognition allowing compiler to properly handle `Obj.magic` and similar primitives without value restriction ([ocaml/ocaml#14029](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14029))
- __RUMINANT:oxcaml__ **SIMD vec256 stabilization** for improved vector operations performance ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4345](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4345))
- __RUMINANT:oxcaml__ **Atomic record fields support** with new `[@atomic]` attribute on mutable fields enabling lock-free programming ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4132](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4132), [oxcaml/oxcaml#4228](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4228), [oxcaml/oxcaml#4231](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4231))
- __RUMINANT:oxcaml__ **Enhanced DWARF debugging** with new configuration flag `--dwarf` to enable OxCaml-specific DWARF output ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4418](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4418))
- __RUMINANT:tools__ **OxCaml parameterized libraries** in [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) with experimental library_parameter stanza and comprehensive documentation ([ocaml/dune#11963](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11963))
- __RUMINANT:tools__ **Cram test timeout support** in [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) allowing per-test time limits ([ocaml/dune#12041](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12041))
- __RUMINANT:tools__ **Filesystem rename operations** in [ocsigen/js_of_ocaml](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml) for fake and Node.js backends with Windows compatibility ([ocsigen/js_of_ocaml#2080](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2080))
- __RUMINANT:ecosystem__ **DNS stack 10.2.0** comprehensive release with 13 packages including dns-certify, dns-cli, dns-client variants, dns-mirage, dns-resolver, dns-server, dns-stub, dns-tsig, and dnssec

weekly_summary.activity_summary: Runtime performance enhancements, flambda2 type system improvements, governance policy development, and cross-platform compatibility work
weekly_summary.activity:
- __RUMINANT:core__ **Runtime performance enhancements** dominated [ocaml/ocaml](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml) with multiple merged optimizations affecting garbage collection, fiber management, and memory profiling by [Florian Angeletti](https://github.com/Octachron) and Nick Barnes ([ocaml/ocaml#14168](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14168), [ocaml/ocaml#14169](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14169), [ocaml/ocaml#13580](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13580))
- __RUMINANT:core__ **Governance policy development** through extensive review of the OCaml Language Committee conflict of interest policy in [ocaml/RFCs#55](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/55)
- __RUMINANT:oxcaml__ **Match-in-match optimization work** by [Basile Clément](https://github.com/bclement-ocp) including relations-as-projections implementation ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4390](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4390)) and improved naked immediates meet algorithm ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4394](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4394))
- __RUMINANT:oxcaml__ **Runtime quotations development** by Andrej Ivašković adding `<[, ]>` syntax and splicing with `$` for metaprogramming ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4395](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4395))
- __RUMINANT:multicore__ **Fiber.any behavior improvement** discussion continued by Adam Cholewiński with review feedback from Thomas Leonard regarding prioritizing value return over cancellation in [ocaml-multicore/eio#806](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/806)
- __RUMINANT:ecosystem__ **OCaml 5 compatibility** improvements for memtrace.0.1 and qcheck-lin packages by [Jan Midtgaard](https://github.com/jmid) to address trunk/OCaml 5.5 incompatibilities
- __RUMINANT:tools__ **OxCaml integration work** progressing in [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) with parameter implementation and tutorial documentation by [Etienne](https://github.com/maiste) ([ocaml/dune#12002](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/pull/12002), [ocaml/dune#12111](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/pull/12111))
weekly_summary.cross_repository_work:
- __RUMINANT:core__ **Shared contributor involvement** with [Florian Angeletti](https://github.com/Octachron) leading runtime improvements in [ocaml/ocaml](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml) while authoring the conflict of interest policy RFC in [ocaml/RFCs#55](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/55)
- __RUMINANT:oxcaml__ **Compiler version synchronization** between [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) and [oxcaml/merlin](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin) with [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) merging OxCaml 5.2.0minus-16 changes ([oxcaml/merlin#172](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/172))
- __RUMINANT:ecosystem__ **OCaml 5 compatibility** coordination between package distribution and documentation systems, with opam-repository receiving compatibility fixes while ocaml.org prepares build infrastructure for upcoming OCaml releases
- __RUMINANT:tools__ **OxCaml ecosystem coordination** between [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) parameterized libraries and package management discussions involving opam overlay strategies ([ocaml/dune#11652](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11652))
- **Jane Street feature integration** continuing with `%identity` nonexpansive recognition ([ocaml/ocaml#14029](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14029)) and include functor implementation from OxCaml ([ocaml/ocaml#14177](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14177))
weekly_summary.notable_discussions:
- __RUMINANT:core__ **Effect keyword syntax proposal** by [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter) suggesting syntactic sugar for effect declarations similar to exceptions, ultimately concluding that current `type _ eff +=` syntax remains acceptable ([ocaml/ocaml#14178](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14178))
- __RUMINANT:core__ **Conflict of interest policy framework** extensively discussed by [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche), [Jeremy Yallop](https://github.com/yallop), and Guillaume Munch-Maccagnoni covering institutional vs. company affiliations and decision-making transparency in [ocaml/RFCs#55](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/55)
- __RUMINANT:oxcaml__ **Contractive type parameters** debate between [Leo White](https://github.com/lpw25) and [Richard Eisenberg](https://github.com/goldfirere) about motivation and interaction with datatype plans, with concrete examples for fixpoint patterns and capability types ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4400](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4400))
- __RUMINANT:ecosystem__ **Dark mode accessibility problems** highlighted by [Yawar Amin](https://github.com/yawaramin) showing insufficient color contrast ratios that fail WCAG 2 AA standards ([ocaml/ocaml.org#3234](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3234))
- __RUMINANT:tools__ **Package rebuilding optimization** in [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) addressing unnecessary dependency rebuilds when parallelism settings change, with [Stephen Sherratt](https://github.com/gridbugs) proposing GNU job server protocol adoption ([ocaml/dune#12103](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12103))
weekly_summary.emerging_trends:

- **Governance formalization** trend with the OCaml Language Committee establishing formal conflict of interest policies and transparency requirements in __RUMINANT:core__ ([ocaml/RFCs#55](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/55))

- **Cross-platform robustness emphasis** addressing Windows filesystem operations, mingw compilation, and Linux distribution compatibility challenges across __RUMINANT:tools__ and __RUMINANT:ecosystem__ groups
- **Metaprogramming capabilities** development with runtime quotations adding compile-time code generation features to the language in __RUMINANT:oxcaml__ ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4395](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4395))
